BarChartHorz.name: Bar Chart (Horizontal)
BarChartHorz.title: Real GDP Change in the US
BarChartHorz.about: Percent Change of U.S. Real Gross Domestic Product from Preceding Period. Data source: U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis

BarChartHorzInteractive.name: Bar Chart (Interactive)
BarChartHorzInteractive.title: Real GDP Change in the US
BarChartHorzInteractive.about: Percent Change of U.S. Real Gross Domestic Product from Preceding Period. Data source: U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis

BarChartVert.name: Bar Chart (Vertical)
BarChartVert.title: Real GDP Change in the US
BarChartVert.about: Percent Change of U.S. Real Gross Domestic Product from Preceding Period. Data source: U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis

BoxPlot.name: Box Plot
BoxPlot.title: Monthly gasoline sales Jan - Dec 2020
BoxPlot.about:
Adjusted monthly gasoline sales in the U.S. in 2020.
Numbers are shown in millions of dollars.
Data source: U.S. Census Bureau

HeatMap.name: Heat Map
HeatMap.title: Twenty Years of NBA Draft Picks
HeatMap.about: This chart colors each player by VORP (Value over Replacement Player), which converts the BPM rate into an estimate of each player's overall contribution to the team, measured vs. what a theoretical 'replacement player' would provide, where the 'replacement player' is defined as a player onminimum salary or not a normal vmember of a team's rotation. A VORP of -20 is used for players that did not play enough minutes. Original visualization by Russell Goldenberg at The Pudding.

MosaicPlot.name: Mosaic Plot
MosaicPlot.title: Share of Women in Job Levels
MosaicPlot.about: This mosaic plot shows that the percentage of women declines as the job level goes higher. Original visualization by Emma Whyte.

TowerChart.name: Tower Chart
TowerChart.title: Presidential Election 2020
TowerChart.about:
This tower chart shows the results of the 2020 presidential election.
Blue represents Biden, red represents Trump.
Each rectangle represents a state that a candidate has won.
The x axis represents the margin of victory for each candidate in terms of popular vote (%).
The y axis represents the number of electoral votes.
Data source: National Archives

BubblePlot.name: Bubble Plot
BubblePlot.title: Habitable Planets
BubblePlot.about:
A visualization showing 1626 planets and which ones are habitable. Temperature should not be too hot or too cold. The mass also plays a role: a small planet can't have an atmosphere, while a large one will have a crushing atmosphere.
Original visualization by John Tomanio and Xaquin G.V., NGM STAFF.
Source: Abel Méndez, Planetary Habitability Laboratory, University of Puerto Rico at Arecibo.

DoughnutChart.name: Doughnut Chart
DoughnutChart.title: How do Americans Spend Their Time?
DoughnutChart.about: Average time spent across a number of common activities by Americans between 15 and 64. Data source: Our World in Data

PieChart.name: PieChart
PieChart.title: How do Americans Spend Their Time?
PieChart.about: Average time spent across a number of common activities by Americans between 15 and 64. Data source: Our World in Data

RadialBarChart.name: Radial Bar Chart
RadialBarChart.title: Monthly Gasoline Sales
RadialBarChart.about:
Adjusted monthly gasoline sales in the U.S. in 2020.
Numbers are shown in millions of dollars.
Data source: U.S. Census Bureau

RoseChart.name: Rose Chart
RoseChart.title: Nightingale's Rose Diagram
RoseChart.about:
A reproduction of Florence Nightingale’s rose diagram.
Data Source: Nightingale, F., Farr, W., & Smith, A. (1859). A contribution to the sanitary history of the British army during the late war with Russia. John W. Parker and Son.

Scatterplot.name: Scatterplot
Scatterplot.title: GDP per capita vs. Life expectancy

BumpChart.name: Bump Chart
BumpChart.title: Color popularity in new cars
BumpChart.about:
This bump chart shows how the rankings of new car colors change over the years in North America. The magenta color denotes 'other' colors.
Original visualization by Rody Zakovich

ConnectedScatterPlot.name: Connected Scatter Plot
ConnectedScatterPlot.title: Driving Shifts into Reverse
ConnectedScatterPlot.about: the shifting relationship between the price of gas and the average number of miles driven in a year, adapted from Driving Shifts Into Reverse by Hannah Fairfield, The New York Times (May 2, 2010)

DumbbellChart.name: Dumbbell Chart
DumbbellChart.title: Partisan Reactions on Mass Shooting
DumbbellChart.about:
This infographics shows the topics mentioned by the two parties after the Orlando nightclub shooting with a focus on the differences in terms of the number of times these topics are mentioned.
Original visualization by Lindsey Poulter
Image credit: DonkeyHotey

LineGraph.name: Line Graph 1
LineGraph.title: Temperature Forecast
LineGraph.about:
Monthly temperature forecast for Baltimore, MD from Aug 2021 to Aug 2022.
The light blue band represents the 99% confidence interval of the prediction.
The solid line represents the median temperature between 1981 and 2010 for each month.
Data source: National Weather Service Forecast

LineGraph2.name: Line Graph 2
LineGraph2.title: Covid Cases: Reported and Forecast
LineGraph2.about:
Reported COVID-19 cases between 7/12/21 to 7/26/21 and forecase by four different models between 7/26/21 and 8/21/21.
The four models are: MIT-Cassandra, UCLA, JHU-CSSE, and Microsoft.
Data Source: Google Search for COVID-19 statistics and CDC

LollipopChart.name: Lollipop Chart
LollipopChart.title: London Borough Crime Rate
LollipopChart.about: Overall crime rate (number of crimes per 1000 people) in London between May 2019 and April 2022. Data source: crimerate.co.uk

MultiLineGraph.name: Multi-Line Graph
MultiLineGraph.title: Stock Market
MultiLineGraph.about: Monthly Stock Prices of four companies: Amazon, Apple, IBM and Microsoft from Jan 1, 2000 to Mar 1, 2010. Original visualization was composed using d3.js on d3noob.org

ParallelCoordinates.name: Parallel Coordinates
ParallelCoordinates.title: Features of Cars
ParallelCoordinates.about: This visualization shows the the features of 406 cars. Original visualization appeared in Robert Spence's book Information Visualization: an Introduction, page 69.

RangeChart.name: Range Chart
RangeChart.title: Boston Weather
RangeChart.about:
This visualization shows daily maximum and minimum temperature for a year in Boston.
Original visualization by Timm Kekeritz of Raureif was in the Polar space, we demonstrate how to create similar designs in the Cartesian space.

SlopeGraph.name: Slope Graph
SlopeGraph.title: Obesity and Education
SlopeGraph.about:
This visualization shows that on average, percentage of obesity is inversely correlated with the percentage of population having a bachelor degree or higher. Each line represents a U.S. state. The left axis represents the obesity percentages, the right axis represents the percentages of people with a higher education.
Original visualization created by Alberto Cairo.

StringlineChart.name: Stringline Chart
StringlineChart.title: Caltrain Schedule
StringlineChart.about: This visualization shows the Caltrian timetable following the style of E. J. Marey's graphical schedule. Each line is a train, and the slope represents the speed of the train. The lines are colored by the type of train.

AreaChart.name: Area Chart
AreaChart.title: Bitcoin prices: 2013 to 2018
AreaChart.about: This visualization shows the evolution of the bitcoin price from 2013-04-28 to 2018-04-23. The original visualization was composed using d3.js on d3-graph-gallery.com.

RadarChart.name: Radar Chart
RadarChart.title: Monthly Gasoline Sales
RadarChart.about:
Adjusted monthly gasoline sales in the U.S. in 2020.
Numbers are shown in millions of dollars.
Data source: U.S. Census Bureau

ridgelinePlot.name: Ridgeline Plot
ridgelinePlot.title: How People Perceive Probability
ridgelinePlot.about: On the /r/samplesize thread of reddit, questions like What probability would you assign to the phrase “Highly likely” were asked. Answers between 0 and 100 were recorded, and this visualization shows the distribution for each question. This idea originally comes from a publication of the CIA. Zoni Nation reproduced it using R. This visualization is based on an example from d3-graph-gallery.com

StackedAreaChart.name: Stacked Area Chart
StackedAreaChart.title: Unemployment by Industry
StackedAreaChart.about: This visualization shows the evolution of the number of unemployed people in four industries (Manufacturing, Leisure and hospitality, Business services and Construction) from 2000 to 2010. The original visualization was composed using d3.js on observablehq.com.

StellarChart.name: Stellar Chart
StellarChart.title: Monthly Gasoline Sales
StellarChart.about:
Adjusted monthly gasoline sales in the U.S. in 2020.
Numbers are shown in millions of dollars.
Data source: U.S. Census Bureau

StreamGraph.name: StreamGraph
StreamGraph.title: Unemployment by Industry
StreamGraph.about: This visualization shows the evolution of the number of unemployed people in four industries (Manufacturing, Leisure and hospitality, Business services and Construction) from 2000 to 2010. The original visualization was composed using d3.js on observablehq.com.

ViolinPlot.name: Violin Plot
ViolinPlot.title: Setosa Sepal Length Distribution
ViolinPlot.about: This visualization shows the distribution for the sepal length of setosa, a type of iris plant. The data is from Iris Data Set.

TidyTree.name: 'Tidy' Tree
TidyTree.title: Node-link tree
TidyTree.about: Node-link visualization of a tree usign the Reingold-Tilford 'tidy' layout algorithm.

GridAreaChart.name: Area Charts
GridAreaChart.title: Unemployment: 2000 to 2010
GridAreaChart.about: This visualization shows the evolution of the number of unemployed people in four industries (Manufacturing, Leisure and hospitality, Business services and Construction) from 2000 to 2010.

MultipleBarCharts.name: Bar Charts
MultipleBarCharts.title: Unemployment Rates by State
MultipleBarCharts.about:
This visualization shows how the unemployment rate for each U.S. state changed from 1980 to 2015 at five-year intervals.
The height of bar represents the difference of unemployment rate from the national average. Data source: Federal Reserve Bank.

MultipleBoxPlots.name: Box Plots
MultipleBoxPlots.title: Gender Pay Gap
MultipleBoxPlots.about:
This box and whisker plot shows the disparity in annual income for women vs. men across pay grades.
Original visualization from Now You See It by Stephen Few.

MultiplePieCharts.name: Pie Charts
MultiplePieCharts.title: Household Spending Patterns
MultiplePieCharts.about: Comparing household spending patterns in the UK and New Zealand in 1980 and 2008. Data source is here.

ScatterplotMatrix.name: Scatterplot Matrix
ScatterplotMatrix.title: Iris Species: Sepal and Petal
ScatterplotMatrix.about: Four measurements (sepal length, sepal width, petal length, petal width) for 150 flowers representing three species of iris (Iris setosa, versicolor and virginica)

MultipleViolinPlots.name: Violin Plots
MultipleViolinPlots.title: Iris Sepal Length Distribution
MultipleViolinPlots.about: This visualization shows the distributions for the sepal length of three types of iris plant: setosa, versicolor and virginica. The data is from Iris Data Set.

MultipleWaffleCharts.name: Waffle Charts
MultipleWaffleCharts.title: Distributions of cars by year
MultipleWaffleCharts.about: This visualization shows the distributions for the sepal length of three types of iris plant: setosa, versicolor and virginica. The data is from Iris Data Set.
